{"step_by_step_thinking": "The infrahyoid muscles are a group of four muscles under the hyoid bone that play a role in swallowing. These muscles are innervated by the ansa cervicalis, which is a loop of nerves that is part of the cervical plexus. The vagus nerve, glossopharyngeal nerve, and mandibular nerve do not supply the infrahyoid muscles.", "answer_choice": "A"}
